author: A_Brickset_user
title: Small Set Great Fun
review: I got this set a few years ago. It is simple , but the minifig is great. I love his cool little helmet, Ialso love his flippers and knives.So if you collect small , simple Legos this set is sure to take you on many fun adventures.

author: jman
title: Brilliant!! Small Aqua Set
review: This is a great little set that in light of it's small size offers great play adventures on it's own. An Aqua diver whose equipment (knife and flippers) become part of the scooter when not being used and a control panel (no sticker...yeah). Well Worth the money if you can find one!!!!

author: mrmitch
title: Worth every penny - if you see it buy it.
review: Very inexpensive LEGO set around one US dollar. Great mini figure with flippers and a silver knife. The helment is different than most Aqua Divers I have in my collection. Simple set with just a few pieces, easy to put together, little set has alot of playability. Recommend this little set if you happen to come across it.

author: JSB23
title: Nostalgia wave!
review:
I remember waking my mom up at 6:30 on Christmas 1998 and making her help me build it (I was three) and then running all over the house making it "fly" on to the reveiw

Pieces 
It has 2 knives quite rare and a diving helmet 5/5

Features
none N/A

Minifigs
one diver 3/5

Overall
Nothing too flashy or interesting but still a great set 5/5

author: Odeinoichus
title: Aquazone Reviews Begin
review:
Set #1806 Underwater Scooter: LEGO Aquazone, one of my all time favorite short run Themes. And I'm an Aquaphobe in real life, well not entirely, I just can't put my head under water or I'll start to panic and tense up and such. But I digress.

 

LEGO Aquazone introduced under water adventures as the Aquanauts searched through the depths for the powerful and mysterious energy crystals. Their competition were the Aquasharks, the Aquaraiders and the Stingrays. Their allies were the Hydronauts.

 

This was one of the few sets I picked up, it was an impulse buy with a unique looking Mini-Figure and a small underwater vehicle. Like something out of James Bond or something. The model is a simple build with few pieces, but it is fun to play with. There are endless possibilities with this little set, also it is the only one with the Mini-Figure with the black visored helmet if memory serves.

 

Overall I'd recommend this set to any fans of the Aquazone Theme, there are a lot of possibilities and buying up more than one of this set troop builds your Aquanauts. As a bonus you get two silver chromed daggers and if memory serves this set also included flippers for the Aquanaut to use while exploring.

author: Pheedle
title: Nostalgia is a powerful, blinding force
review:
When I was a young lad, maybe 10 or so, ever few weekends my Nana and Pop would take us kids to the shops. And back in these ancient days, you could expect to stroll into a shopping center and find an array of tiny lego sets like this one for about $5. It became tradition that Nana would sneakily give me a $10 note and tell me to buy two. Nostalgia is indeed a powerful force. 

Parts

For such a tiny set, there are some worthwhile pieces here. The chrome knives were a mainstay of sets at the time, and they give great detail to any set or scene.

Minifigures

Whilst the fellow himself is fairy common fare for the set, its the helmet and mask that I remember best. The big, white piece fit over head and body and added to the underwater explorer feel. Sadly I don't feel that Ive seen enough of these in recent years. 

Overall opinion

From an objective view this set is at best a filler piece for a larger display. However from a nostalgia perspective, it brings back great memories of itself and much of the 90's lego. I still have the original set, proudly displayed alongside the larger Aquazone sets.
